title: Princess Leah
author: Princess Leah
content: Lots of people especially those with little knowledge about Bitcoin and it's mode of operations, would be wondering why Bitcoin is the most talked about crypto asset to invest on currently but this image below would help enlighten them with a clue to what they need to understand.  Further more in summary of what the image above portrays, based on the bitcoin halving Bitcoin becomes more scarce and it's value surges very high, therefore since we're in the season of the bitcoin halving investing in it currently seems like the best decision anyone could take currently, if you noticed many industrials and financial institutions are acquiring more Bitcoin currently instead of selling so it's in the best interest of individuals to take advantage of this information and invest on Bitcoin while it's not yet very late. As you can see, unlike other Assets, Bitcoin is a decentralised asset and can't be created more, but increases in value when it's price is halved. But note that Bitcoin as an asset is very volatile in nature, therefore you shouldn't invest all your savings but a spare money you could lose without getting very emotional. However everyone needs to take advantage of this years halving and take profits to prepare for the next very early.

comments.author: Don Pedro Dinero
comments.body: Quote from: tranthidung on April 09, 2024, 01:04:45 PMOh seriously and really?Bitcoin has been creating more, with its each new block. What will happen with each Bitcoin block found by miners since 2009 so far and even the halving next 10 days?Many more new bitcoins will be created from future Bitcoin blocks. I know what you implied but you expressed it inaccurately. You can say, there will be not more than 21M bitcoins ever because the Protocol coded by Satoshi Nakamoto.Good nuance, although it is understood what she meant.  I would like to introduce another point here that has not been touched upon in either the OP or the comments above. The supply of bitcoin cannot be changed depending on demand. If there is more demand for gold or another commodity, the price goes up and since it is more profitable, producers start producing more, which causes, over time, the price to go down. Conversely, if the price goes down, producers stop producing so much, or some stop or go bankrupt, and as production is reduced, the price eventually goes up again. This would be like this in very broad strokes but what I wanted to exemplify is that this cannot be done with bitcoin. There is a total production limit of approximately 21 million and there is a fixed production per mined block that cannot be varied either by supply and demand or by price variation.

comments.author: m2017
comments.body: Quote from: Princess Leah on April 09, 2024, 12:00:46 PM~snip"Why is Bitcoin the best asset for investment currently?" - maybe because this investment asset brings crazy returns, incomparable to the profits received from building real estate, issuing shares, printing fiat money, or mining gold.Bitcoin is the most talked about crypto asset for investment due to its hype. Long drops, sharp rises in value, intermediate oscillations similar to a roller coaster, multiple increases in price - all this doesn't leave ordinary people indifferent, for many of whom this is a ticket to a happy life, but few dare to take risks. Therefore, discussions about bitcoin don't stop, even in the central media.People's interest is not due to the reduction every 4 years in the amount of mined bitcoins, but due to the fact that this leads to an increase in price. People are attracted not by the limited bitcoin's emission, but by the speculative nature of this crypto asset. That is, the opportunity to buy cheaper and sell more expensive. comments.author: YOSHIE
comments.body: Quote from: Princess Leah on April 09, 2024, 12:00:46 PMWhy is Bitcoin the best asset for investment currently?Some users and countries may think Bitcoin is an investment asset, but not all users and countries think the same thing, Bitcoin tends to be clarified as a trading asset or as a digital asset in digital payment methods, for example as is currently being done by the country of El Salvador.The reason is based on the fact that Bitcoin tends to work more with a network system (peer to peer). Many people think that investment tends to be long-term, while trading tends to be more peer-to-peer, where while you are connected to a computer/laptop and the internet you are still safe to trade, as well as digital payment system methods.Investment tends to focus on the long term, you wait too long for your investment to grow, unless it's like what's happening now with the halving, once every four years your investment will certainly be useful, However, not some investors think of Bitcoin as a digital asset that is traded short-term.
